Class MergeSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • MergeSort

  • public class MergeSort
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the functionality for the merge sort algorithm. This class was written with assistance from Chapter 19 of Java, How to Program Early Object by Dietel and Deitel.
    Author:
    Sophia Mallaro
    See Also:
    MergeSort

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MergeSort() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void merge(int[] arr, int min, int middle, int middle2, int max)
      This method merges sorted arrays together
      static void mergeSort(int[] array)
      This method calls sort the first time.
      static void sort(int[] arr, int min, int max)
      This method recursively calls sort until the arrays are divided up into single elements

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MergeSort

        public MergeSort()

    • Method Detail

      • mergeSort

        public static void mergeSort(int[] array)
        This method calls sort the first time. Sort is recursively called additional times.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be sorted

      • sort

        public static void sort(int[] arr,
                        int min,
                        int max)
        This method recursively calls sort until the arrays are divided up into single elements
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to be sorted
        min - Minimum index of section to be sorted
        max - Maximum index of section to be sorted

      • merge

        public static void merge(int[] arr,
                         int min,
                         int middle,
                         int middle2,
                         int max)
        This method merges sorted arrays together
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to be merged
        min - Minimum element
        middle - End of section 1
        middle2 - End of section 2
        max - Maximum element
